text: The process of activation involves calcium mobilization , activation of protein kinase C ( PKC ) , and phosphorylation of tyrosine kinases .
<extra_id_0> p21(ras) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a guanine nucleotide binding factor , mediates T-cell signal transduction through PKC - dependent and PKC - independent pathways .

The involvement of <extra_id_0> p21(ras) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the regulation of calcium - dependent signals has been suggested through analysis of its role in the activation of NF-AT .

We have investigated the inductions of the IE genes in response to calcium signals in Jurkat cells ( in the presence of activated <extra_id_0> p21(ras) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and their correlated consequences .

text: This inhibition of calcium - activated IE gene induction was reversed by treatment with cyclosporin A , suggesting the involvement of calcineurin in this regulation .

text: These results suggest that <extra_id_0> p21(ras) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an essential mediator in generating not only positive but also negative modulatory mechanisms controlling the competence of T cells in response to inductive stimulations .
